page.title: 04A LOCAL MAGISTRATE
page.content: MR.A.CHARLESWORTH SITS IN COURT WITH TWO OTHER J.P'S AND A CLERK, who is the only trained person on the bench. he was proposed as a magistrate by a friend and appointed by the House of Lords.He first sat on the Epworth bench in 1970 and was one of 9 magistrates or justices of the peace.In 1978 with the creation of Humberside he was appointed to Goole too .Magistrates wear no uniform.There are as many women as men.Magistrates listen to the evidence and come to a decision.Only the chairman speaks.The clerk gives advice.Magistrates deal with minor offences, and send more serious crimes to higher courts.The most serious crime he tried was when ships docking at Goole were found to have dogs on board illegally.These had not been quarantined and could have brought rabies into the country.
